description:
A calldisplay is a device to call people in a waiting room to a workstation. Usually it is a display on wall showing process ids together with a room number.
The clusters are resolved to fill the list of scopes. The text displayed on the calldisplay depends on the given scopes. If only one scope is present, a text can be displayed on the display. On multiple scopes, no text and no image is displayed.

image.description: A symbolic image for the scope

mime.description: mime type of the base64 encoded image

serverTime.description: unix timestamp of the server time to adjust the clock on the call display
